My argument against the Bering Straight crossing is simple!! And given that in the "early Earth" Europe and North America were much closer together, it makes far more sense that human would have crossed there than they would have all the way north in what is now the Bering Sea!! Further evidence of this is the Younger Dryus people that lived in what is modern day New Jersey, Rhode Island and Connecticut!!! Other proof that this might actually be logical is the fact of stone tools found in New Jersey and France appear to be of similar design and pre dates the Clovis People of New Mexico that had similar tools!!!

In order to level this out, and then add sand for the base, there had to be several feet dugout with a bulldozer. Going out to look at the site the next morning, he found a Stone Point laying up on top of the ground. With there being absolutely no mistake about it, upon looking at it, I immediately identified it as a Folsom point. What was it doing there several feet into the ground of Southern Michigan? The sauk, Fox, Sioux, Ojibwe, Potawatomi, Iroquois, and other bands traveled in and out of Michigan area for many millennia. Love the channel and all it's sister channels. I would like to request a topic which the general population does not know about. It's Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs). They are non-enzymatic reaction of sugar to long lived proteins. The reaction can take more than 60 days and it's directly related to sugar concentration in the body. Once the sugar reacts with the protein it can alter its function and AGEs gradually build up in the body. It has been proven that AGEs are linked to chronic diseases, specially diseases that are usually occur with age (arthrosclerosis, cataracts). HbA1C test is measuring AGEs levels in your blood cells and it gives average blood sugar levels over 3 month period.
